title: Hommus dip

ingredients.content: 2 tbsp olive oil, plus extra to serve
800 g canned chickpeas, rinsed and drained (approx. 500 g after draining)

preparations.content: Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add chickpeas and lemon juice and mix <b>30 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add tahini and salt and blend <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>, until smooth. Transfer into a serving bowl and sprinkle with za'atar (optional) and extra oil (optional) before serving.

hintsAndTricks: <b>Roasted onion hommus<b>: Replace 400 g chickpeas with 250 g sautéed or roasted onion. Proceed as per recipe. Reserve 2 tablespoons roasted onion for garnishing, if desired.
<b>Spinach and lemon hommus<b>: Replace 400 g chickpeas with 300 g chopped fresh baby spinach leaves and an extra 20 g lemon juice. Proceed as per recipe.
<b>Butternut pumpkin hommus<b>: Replace 400 g chickpeas with 350 g roasted butternut pumpkin, ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon and ¼ teaspoon ground cumin. Proceed as per recipe.
For an extra flavour boost, try sprinkling hommus with some Za'atar seasoning (please refer to the recipe on this recipe chip).
You can store this dip in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
